name: Introductory Physics
description: This course introduces students to the basics of physics. Students will learn about Force, Motion, Energy, Momentum, Waves, Thermodynamics, Electromagnetism and Optics.

name: Classical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles of classical mechanics. Students will learn about Kinematics, Newton's Laws of Motion, Work, Energy, Momentum, Rotational Motion, Oscillations, and Gravitation.

name: Electromagnetism
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles of electromagnetism. Students will learn about Electric Charge, Electric Field, Electric Potential, Capacitance, Current, Resistance, Magnetism, Magnetic Field, and Electromagnetic Induction.

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Students will learn about Heat, Temperature, Laws of Thermodynamics, Carnot Cycles, Entropy, Maxwell-Boltzmann Statistics, and Quantum Statistics.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course explains the fundamental principles of quantum mechanics. Students will learn about Wave-Particle Duality, Uncertainty Principle, Schrodinger Equation, Quantum States, Quantum Tunneling, and Quantum Entanglement.

name: Special Relativity
description: This course is an introduction to Einstein's Special Theory of Relativity. Topics include Time Dilation, Length Contraction, Lorentz Transformations, Minkowski Spacetime, Relativistic Energy and Momentum, and Black Holes.

name: General Relativity
description: This course introduces students to Einstein's general theory of relativity which extended his special theory. Students will learn about Curved Space-time, the Equivalence Principle, Gravitational Waves, Black Holes, Cosmology, and Dark Matter.

name: Quantum Field Theory
description: This course explores the foundations of quantum field theory and its applications to particle physics. Topics include the mathematics of Quantum Field Theory, Symmetries and Conservation Laws, the Standard Model of Particle Physics, and the Higgs Mechanism.
